Joseph Rickert inspired me to learn using the Support Vector Machine (SVM) method by his post on the [Revolutions blog](http://blog.revolutionanalytics.com/2015/10/the-5th-tribe-support-vector-machines-and-caret.html). He cites [A Practical Guide to Support Vector Classification](https://www.csie.ntu.edu.tw/~cjlin/papers/guide/guide.pdf) of Hsu et al. who suggest a simple methodology to follow for newbys in SVM:

1. Transform data to the format of a SVM package
2. Conduct simple scaling on the data
3. Consider the RBF kernel $K(x, y) = exp (−γ||x−y||^{2})$
4. Use cross-validation to find the best parameter C and γ
5. Use the best parameter C and γ to train the whole training set
6. Test
